page.title: 19HEALTH
page.content: In Alford there is a group practice of medical doctors,{Dr Ferguson, Spencely and{Dunnet}to be joined by{Dr {Charlton.Dr Le Page}is now part time. Surgeries take place every morning, afternoon and evening. There are five full time secretaries doubling as receptionists, a part time dispenser and receptionist. There is one practice nurse and four district nurses based at the surgery in Windmill Lane, plus two health visitors and a midwife. A chiropodist visits the clinic every Tuesday and regular baby and Ante Natal clinics occur.{Alford Hospital}has eighteen beds. The Alford doctors see to the medical care. It is run by 3 sisters, 4 staff nurses and 8 auxillaries. It has casualty facilities and a physiotherapy clinic.
